Gibbs draws a bead on the President, smiles... but he doesn't have any strength left to pull the trigger. He expires. And the plane begins to dive. Marshall runs for the cockpit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rose and her Ranger are pulled aboard the transport.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shepherd and his Ranger clip onto the wire, but the KC-lO is now higher than Air Force One.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With Marshall back at the yoke.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Air Force One, you're losing altitude.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can't hold it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .   KC-LO PILOT (V.0.)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The KC-lO transport dips lower and lower, trying to maintain its position under the descending plane.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Tower, Romeo Tango Zulu. The First Lady is onboard. Air Force One, status?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We've lost two of your men. There's no one to fly the plane.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.0.) We can send another one over.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No time. I only have one engine left.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Come on!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With the KC-lO back in the Position, Shepherd and his Ranger shove off the dying plane toward safety.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What about the President?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's on his way.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . WHITE HOUSE SITUATION ROOM - NIGHT KC-L0 PILOT The Chief of Staff is onboard. We are at six thousand feet descending rapidly. Everyone's biting their nails.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . AIR FORCE ONE COCKPIT - NIGHT MARSHALL I can't stabilize it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marshall holds the yoke in one hand and unclips the snatch harness from the dead ranger in the co-pilot's seat. The last red light on the engine control panel starts to flash.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marshall, still fighting the yoke, stands. He takes a deep breatn, drops the wheel and runs like a motherfucker for the stairs.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Sir, we're going to pound pavement in less than three minutes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . Drops into a banking twist. The cable line runs taut. The KC-lO tries to compensate.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: . CABIN Marshall dives down the stairs from the upper deck, comes up sprinting for the door.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . AIR FORCE ONE, COCKPIT - Engine four fails.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.0.) She's out of control. I can't pace her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The taut straining cable snaps one corner of the metal clasp. The clasp starts to bend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sprinting to the open door. The clasp twisting. The cable hook ready to slip of f it. Marshall clips on, and dives out of the door. He slides forty feet down, when.... The clasp gives. The cable line snaps away from the plane... one end connected to the KC-l0, the other connected to... Nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marshall slides down the cable, gripping at it, trying to break his fall. Air Force One plummets toward the water. Marshall sliding, right behind it, running out of cable. At the end of his rope, literally. Marshall's harness snags on the end clasp. He hangs on for dear life. Moments later Air Force One impacts. A huge EXPLOSION, water and flames blows sky high into the night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tower. Air Force One is down...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dead silence as all the patrons stare up at the T.V.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No response...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I repeat, Air Force One is down.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Romeo Tango Zulu. Do you have the President?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Romeo Tango Zulu, please respond. Do you have the President? Over. Still no response...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The massive fireball and glowing remains of the Presidential aircraft almost reaches up to where the President struggles to hold on to the end of the cable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Winch it up! Winch it up!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marshall slipping off the line, unable to get a solid hold. His hands slick with blood. The belly of the KC-lO gets closer and closer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He closes his eyes. His fingers begin to give.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Come on. Ten mare seconds.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: All over America, families, gathered around their televisions, wait.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Romeo Tango Zulu, do you have the President? Over.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Stand by.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Romeo Tango Zulu1 this is Tower. Please report. over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A long beat of silence, then...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Another long beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cheers flood the situation room. Cheers flood the Department Store. Cheers flood the press room, the living room, the sports bars, churches, schools, construction sites, hospitals... all across America.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Romeo Tango Zulu, do you copy? Do you have the President?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We copy. Stand by... (beat) Tower?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tower, here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is Romeo Tango Zulu changing call signs. (beat) Tower, alert air traffic, Romeo Tango Zulu is now Air Force One. (beat) This is Air Force One... The President is safe onboard.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Copy, Air Force One.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Marshall huddles tight with Rose and Alice as a MEDIC attends to their wounds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marshall turns to see this soldier, a fresh-faced, 19-year- old kid, saluting his Commander-in-chief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marshall returns the salute.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Mr. President?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Welcome aboard, sir.
